data.title: Andre Agassi Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Andre Agassi with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Began playing tennis as soon as he could walk, using courts at the Tropicana Hotel in Las Vegas, where his father worked

Attended the prestigious Bollettieri Academy in Florida at age 13

Renowned teacher Nick Bollettieri was so impressed with Andre after watching him hit for 10 minutes that he told Agassi's father he was waiving the camp fee

Won eight Grand Slam tennis singles titles, including four Australian Opens, one French Open, one Wimbledon and two U

S

Opens

Became the fifth player to complete a career Grand Slam with his 1999 French Open title, but first to do so on three different surfaces (grass, clay, hardcourt)

Celebrated at the '99 French Open winner's ball with fellow singles champ Steffi Graf, after which the pair began dating, forming one of the most accomplished couples in sports

Established the Andre Agassi College Preparatory Academy for underprivileged children in a poverty-stricken neighborhood of Las Vegas

Admitted in his 2009 autobiography (Open: An Autobiography) to using methamphetamine in 1997 and wearing a wig during his early days on tour
